medical_history.chief_complaint: Dysmorphic features and recurring respiratory infections.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at birth with a hypotrophic presentation and the need for CPAP ventilation. Notable dysmorphic features were observed immediately. The patient experienced recurring infections, starting with an upper airway infection at 6 weeks, followed by pneumonia at 12 weeks, leading to severe respiratory distress and death at 10 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Maternal hypothyroidism and gestational diabetes during pregnancy.
